page.title: 05TROUT FISHERIES
page.content: {Brick House}has just changed hands.It is a large red bricked mansion standing next to the{Trout Fisheries. This farm breeds river trout,eels and sells these plus shellfish.Further up the Stambridge Road is the{Post Office and General Store.This is the only shop between Canewdon and Rochford. This part of Stambridge is mainly ribbon development, but the exception to the rule is{Cagefield {Road. }All the properties in this road are council houses built before the Second World War.There are no special occasions or traditions in Stambridge. It is a very quiet village. There are two public houses in Stambridge. They are situated at each end of the village. One is called the {Cherry {Tree}and the other is called the { {Royal Oak.}They are both very old buildings.
